description: Borrowed from Latin exeunt (“they leave”), the third-person plural present active indicative of exeō (“leave”).

entries.meaning: A stage direction for more than one actor to leave the stage.
An act of one or more actors leaving the stage.

verbs.description: exeunt (third-person singular simple present exeunts, present participle exeunting, simple past and past participle exeunted)

entries.meaning: (archaic) They leave the stage (a stage direction to two or more actors, the plural counterpart of exit).
